metadata.Title: CVE-2021-24031 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the Zstandard command-line utility prior to v1.4.1, output files were created with default permissions. Correct file permissions (matching the input) would only be set at completion time. Output files could therefore be readable or writable to unintended parties.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-24031` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzstd1 - 1.3.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1.2
zstd - 1.3.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libzstd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1.2').
